verdict.summary: next.config.js contains invalid or deprecated configuration options.

dead_ends.action: Downgrading Next.js to match the old config format
dead_ends.why_fails: Loses security patches and new features

dead_ends.action: Suppressing the warning with typescript/eslint rules
dead_ends.why_fails: The config error is at build time, not lint time

workarounds.action: Check Next.js migration guide for your version and update deprecated options
workarounds.how: Each major version has a migration guide with config changes

workarounds.action: Use the Next.js config type for autocomplete: /** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */
workarounds.how: TypeScript-powered autocomplete catches invalid options before build

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'err-next-config-invalid' and 'not-found-function' differ in root cause and environment context.
Both produce similar messages, but 'err-next-config-invalid' and 'metadata-not-supported-client' differ in root cause and environment context.
